abstract: Fifteen percent of Americans do not use the Internet — essentially the same portion of the population that did not go online in 2013 — according to a new Pew Research Center study.

headline.main: A Steady Percentage of Americans Still Do Not Go Online, Study Says
headline.print_headline: Numbers Steady for Americans Not on the Internet

snippet: Fifteen percent of Americans do not use the Internet — essentially the same portion of the population that did not go online in 2013 — according to a new Pew Research Center study.
